definitions: framework of metal bars used to hold fuel in a fireplace
examples: Coal burned on the iron grate
The decorative grate added charm to the fireplace

definitions: pleasure or satisfaction, especially from achieving something
examples: She found gratification in helping others
The gratification of completing the project was immense

definitions: framework of parallel or crossed bars, typically preventing access
examples: The storm drain had a metal grating
Light filtered through the window grating
The grating protected the ventilation shaft

definitions: quality of being thankful and showing appreciation
examples: She expressed deep gratitude for their help
They showed their gratitude with gifts

definitions: person whose job is digging graves
examples: The gravedigger worked through the night
The old gravedigger knew every plot

definitions: small stones and pebbles used for paths and roads
examples: The driveway was covered with gravel
They spread gravel on the icy road
The gravel pit supplied local construction

definitions: stone marker placed at a grave with inscription
examples: The ancient gravestone was barely readable
They placed flowers by the gravestone
Each gravestone told a family story
The gravestone bore her name and dates

definitions: area of land used for burying the dead
examples: The old graveyard dated back centuries
The graveyard shift starts at midnight

definitions: force of attraction between all masses in the universe
examples: Newton explained gravitation with his laws
Einstein revolutionized our understanding of gravitation

definitions: sauce made from meat juices, often thickened
examples: Turkey gravy completed the holiday meal
She made gravy from the pan drippings
The mashed potatoes needed more gravy
Homemade gravy beats instant every time

definitions: slight injury where skin is scraped
examples: The graze on her knee stung badly
He cleaned the graze with antiseptic
The bicycle accident left several grazes

definitions: act of animals feeding on growing grass
thick oily substance used as lubricant or in cooking
examples: Mechanics use grease on moving parts
The wheel bearings needed fresh grease

definitions: intense selfish desire for wealth, power, or food
examples: Corporate greed led to the scandal

definitions: informal term for US paper money
examples: The greenback strengthened against other currencies
Greenbacks have been redesigned for security

definitions: area of open land around a city where building is restricted
examples: Developers couldn't build in the greenbelt
The city's greenbelt provided recreation space

definitions: green foliage or growing plants collectively
examples: They added greenery to brighten the office

definitions: glass building for growing plants in controlled conditions
examples: Tomatoes grew year-round in the greenhouse
She started seedlings in the greenhouse

definitions: process of becoming more environmentally aware
examples: The greening of cities includes more parks

definitions: strip of undeveloped land for recreation or environmental protection
examples: The greenway connected parks throughout the city
The greenway project took five years

definitions: polite word or gesture when meeting someone
examples: Her warm greeting made visitors comfortable

definitions: imaginary creature blamed for mechanical problems
examples: Pilots blamed gremlins for equipment failures
The car's gremlins acted up again

definitions: small bomb thrown by hand or launched
color between black and white
examples: She painted the walls dove grey

definitions: tall, slender dog breed known for speed
examples: The greyhound won the race easily

definitions: field for American football marked with parallel lines
examples: Players took the gridiron for kickoff
The gridiron was muddy after rain
Friday night lights illuminated the gridiron

definitions: complete standstill in traffic; any deadlock situation
examples: Rush hour gridlock paralyzed the city
They avoided gridlock by leaving early

definitions: real or imagined cause for complaint
examples: Employees filed a grievance with HR

definitions: legendary creature with eagle's head and lion's body
examples: A stone griffin adorned the entrance

definitions: metal framework for cooking food over fire
casual restaurant specializing in grilled food
examples: They ate at the neighborhood grill
The sports grill showed the game

definitions: ornamental framework of metal bars or wires
examples: An ornate grille covered the radiator
The speaker grille had a mesh design

definitions: method of cooking on a grill
intensive questioning or interrogation
dirt ingrained on a surface, especially thick black dirt
examples: Years of grime covered the windows

definitions: broad smile showing teeth
examples: The mischievous grin gave him away

definitions: process of crushing into small particles
tedious daily routine
examples: The grind of gears needed adjustment
The daily grind wore him down
Back to the grind after vacation

definitions: machine for grinding
submarine sandwich
examples: The coffee grinder produced fresh grounds
An angle grinder cut through metal

definitions: process of reducing to powder or small fragments
examples: The grinding of wheat produces flour

definitions: revolving stone wheel for sharpening tools
examples: He sharpened the axe on the grindstone
Keep your nose to the grindstone
The old grindstone still worked well

definitions: term used in Latin America for foreigners, especially Americans
grain that is ground to make flour
examples: The miller brought grist to grind
Fresh grist arrived at the mill
Everything was grist for his stories

definitions: tough inedible tissue in meat
examples: She removed the gristle from the steak
The cheap meat contained too much gristle

definitions: small particles of stone or sand
courage and resolve
large brown bear found in North America
examples: The grizzly stood eight feet tall

definitions: person who sells food and household supplies
examples: The local grocer knew every customer
She asked the grocer for fresh produce

definitions: area between the abdomen and thigh on either side
examples: The athlete pulled a groin muscle
He protected his groin during sports
The doctor examined the groin area
